q: discussing the budget, Colin Powell said that "the real money[ is] in the entitlements... and unless we do something about those, you can't balance the budget." He added, You can't fix the deficit or the national debt by killing NPR or National Endowment for the Humanities or the Arts. Nice political chatter, but that doesn't do it. Donald Rumsfeld , who served as President Bush 's defense chief for six years after holding the same job under president Gerald Ford in the 1970s, acknowledged that in a war, many things cost lives. But he had no regrets about his leadership of the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan-- the latter now nearing its 10th anniversary. He refused to echo the regrets of another domineering defense secretary--

the past. Howard Stern to David Letterman : sorry about your sex scandal( video) Instead of deflecting Howard Stern 's apology, David Letterman responded with candor and a bit of reciprocal praise. "You have been very, very nice to me on the radio and viciously ugly to me on the radio and I except both with equanimity because I know a little bit about how you operate and I'm still fond of your talent and your ability and what you've represented to the United States of America-and of course, the world."
